website_summaries.verdict: An affordable serger with a number of highly desirable features.
pros: Maximum speed is 1,500 stitches per minute
Features color-coded threading guides, adjustable stitch length, and single rotation thread tension dials
The knife system has a dedicated drive for easy cutting
cons: If a small part breaks, it can be more expensive to replace that part than to get a new machine

customer_reviews.title: Juki 644d vs Brother 1034d
customer_reviews.text: Most bang for yer buck. Loving this machine. Kinda sad I wasted 2 years with the Brother 1034d. Kinda happy the motor died on the Brother and I was able to replace it with the Juki! Better stitches and much quieter. Doesn't rattle and shake around like the Brother. Nicer rolled hem. Yay!! I know a lot of people compare these two machines, I did a lot of research before I bought a serger. Definitely casting my vote for the Juki now.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney A Cranch

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 months of use the sewing machine repair guy recommended this serger to me said it was the best
customer_reviews.text: After my brother 1034d broke after only 3 months of use the sewing machine repair guy recommended this serger to me said it was the best! I did my research and discovered that it is top rated and very affordable! I absolutely love it. Very easy to thread and it makes gorgeous rolled hems (something that my brother never did). I definitely recommend this serger. And as a bonus it is very quiet. Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dalla

customer_reviews.title: Works great on thin fabric and loose weave thick fabric!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this 2 mths ago. It runs smoothly so far. It works great on fat loose weave fabric (I eased it over seams that were about 3/8 inch thick) and also performed great on thin t-shirts, so far so good without changing any tensions. It is light enough for me to move. And the hardest thing about threading was through the needle for the lower strings. 4/26/18 Now I see the problem. The stitches don't hold their setting, I can adjust the tension and it looks great for about 2" and then the threads get very loose again. Am I missing something here or is this the status quo for this machine. So sad about this.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine! I bought it to replace my 30 year old Toyota overlock, and I couldn't be happier. The machine is quiet, easy to thread (for a 4-cone overlock, that is) and sews like a dream. I also have a brand new Singer overlock, which pales in comparison. I always recommend this machine to my Garment Constructions students.
customer_reviews.author: Hemi

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my new JUKI!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how quiet, how smooth this machine works. I am used to a swiss made serger and replaced it with this model of JUKI. I am in love with it. Why did I wait so long?? Directions were easy to follow...threading was a snap and the tension is perfect first time around. I like how the little feet have suction to them and keep the machine in place. This is a top shelf machine....you will be very pleased if you make this purchase, I know I sure am.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I read many glowing reviews before i bought this. People said it came already threaded and they just sat down and used it. In my case,it had threads that had been cut off,presumably to tie the thread on from my cones. I did so only to have the lower looper thread break. That's when i discovered the lower looper is a nightmare to thread. The lower looper threader that comes with the machine is basically useless. I had to remove the needle plate to finally get it threaded. It took an hour to do this. I cannot imagine having to go through this every time i need to thread this machine. I will probably send this back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great serger, quick to get the hang of.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. I sew a lot of knits and this is wonderful. Threading is not scary at all, way easier than a Juki Industrial serger by any means. Love that it is light weight and portable but still holds up to the task of knits for swim costumes/dance, etc. No matter what your experience level with serging is, it is totally worth thumbing through the manual, it's pretty straight forward and shows you how to work the differential feed and how to change the amount you want to cut off, how to attach elastic, etc.
customer_reviews.author: nogarr

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: By far this has been my worst experience ordering with Amazon. I purchased this item for my daughter. At the time of ordering it stated apply now for an Amazon store card and get an instant $40.00 off. I applied gave all of my information and order was processed without the $40.00. I immediately called Amazon transfered to 4 people and 1 hr later nothing changed. Not satisfied at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive serger
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my 30 year old bernette/bernina quit working. Bernina sergers are VERY expensive and since I'm in my 60's didn't feel the need for that. This Juki is great! Threads up very similar to my old one. The thing I like best is there is no need to have a separate foot and plate for roll hemming, just slide a button and it's ready to go. 5 stars all the way. Patty O
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: about 300 a year and this machine is the best..
customer_reviews.text: I sew costumes...about 300 a year and this machine is the best...this is my second MO644d.....the first one lasted several years before needing a repair
customer_reviews.author: Pat Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Machine Jammed with first use
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I received a faulty machine, but the first day I opened the box to set it up, the machine began to malfunction. Threading the machine was fine, however something on the inside that is connected to the motor/hand wheel kept jamming. I guess this machine is hit or miss. I tried contacting Juki to no avail. My next step is to return the machine and order another singer singer that I know will work.
customer_reviews.author: D E

customer_reviews.title: Parts are expensive, and made cheap
customer_reviews.text: Well I JUST received this lady on Tuesday, and by yesterday the lower looper fell apart. When I look at it more closely, the part looks like it’s made of plastic. This seems really strange that it wouldn’t be a stronger material than plastic, especially since the lower loopers sold separately are $50! I can not believe I just forked out all this money for this serger, and now have to spend another $50 for it to even work 🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth E Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!! This machine is a challenge, but worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this serger!! If you are new to sewing I would recommend watching videos and threading and rethreading multiple times. I have used it on a couple of projects and it has been really great with most! I did have a difficult time adjusting the tension a few times, the stitch was just coming out too loose. I do believe I need to use it more and become more familiar with the tensions and what they all are for. Other than that this is a great buy! And I recommend it!! It won’t be easy figuring this machine out but it will be worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: I have used a singer serger and this is a VASTLY better machine. It is sturdy, easier to thread than the singer. It sews beautifully. It is reliable. It is about the same price as the singer was. I am very pleased with it. I have sewn for many years and know a well built machine when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: L. O. Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get a good tension set.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this serger. I have had Juki in the past and been pleased, but this serger seems to have a problem with setting a good tension. No matter what I do, I do not get a nice looking stitch. I have been sewing on a serger for years, and this is just no fun.
customer_reviews.author: L. Layton

customer_reviews.title: It's my workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This serger is a work horse for my small business. Serges right over gathered seams without messing up the gathers, has a lot of power but doesn't feel like you're out of control when it's going. Threading was a little weird at first, having to open the left side of it and then loop back through to the right side, but it took no time to get used to it. I've never skipped a stitch or had any issue. I would 10/10 recommend this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Nolte

customer_reviews.title: Juki is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this serger. It is easy to thread, the tension adjusts easily and it has a differential feed. It is quiet, runs smoothly and sews beautiful seams as well as rolled hems. I have had a Bernette (Juki) serger for over 30 years. They are built to last. This serge is a tremendous value and I hope to have it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Ds444

customer_reviews.title: It’s a fake machine.
customer_reviews.text: This product can not be used. It is a fake. Not a real Juki serger. I am an experienced sewing professional and it does not work at all. I want to return (past 30 days due to illness) And Amazon can not be reached. I’m out 260.00 because I was sick and couldn’t use the machine. I’ve had it looked at by a Juki Dealer and it is verified to be unusable from the factory
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Serger
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing serger. It is light weight and runs so smoothly. Great for beginners or experienced sewers. About 3 weeks after purchasing this machine, there was an issue with one of the tension knobs. After talking to Juki, they could walk me through fixing the issue and now it runs beautifully. Juki customer service is wonderful. After talking to them and fixing the issue, they sent me an email to make sure the machine was performing correctly. Great machine and great price!
customer_reviews.author: hayley

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a dream
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Have had cheaper surgers in the past and this thing is like getting a new Mercedes after driving a Honda. The pre-theading made it "sew" easing to set up. Super suction to work surface. Good lighting. It's a bit heavy, but I'm taking that as a sign of quality. Definitely recommend spending a little more cash to get a lot more machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: JUKI MO644D SERGER
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY THIRD SERGER...I NEVER THOUGHT I WOULD BUY ONE ONLINE, BUT ONCE I GOT IT THREADED, IT WORKED BEAUTIFULLY. IT'S MADE WELL AND YOU CAN FEEL IT'S A STURDY MACHINE WHILE YOU'RE SEWING. WAWAK IS A FINE COMPANY TO DEAL WITH. THANKS, SANDEE
customer_reviews.author: sandee

customer_reviews.title: Best brand
customer_reviews.text: OMG, the best serger I could wish for. I worked with Juki industrial so I knew is a great brand. Very easy to use and works very smooth. I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: The HH

customer_reviews.title: No bells and whistles but still very much worth every penny and then some
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent so far. No bells and whistles but still very much worth every penny and then some! Stitch and tension adjustments work well and are very easy to use after a few minutes of learning the machine. The light(er) weight and handle make it perfect for small studio spaces with limited room or lots of other equipment.
customer_reviews.author: A.Y.

customer_reviews.title: This Juki is a gem
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a serger and decided to take the plunge. I'm so glad I purchased this little jewel. The instructions manual is clear and the set up and threading went quickly. I'm gradually upping my skill levels and am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: I've sewed lots already and I'm just a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first serger and I am very new to sergering. I wanted to sew upcycle clothing. I sought out the advice of a sewing class but after hearing the fee of "$100 for 3 hours", I decided to tackle this on my own. After a couple of hours (I just needed to make sure to thread properly:), I made my first piece of upcycle clothing! Then I started making more! I love it! With this purchase, I am on my way to reinventing my entire wardrobe without buying new clothes! I chose this model because it was recommended by Katwise on Etsy and I have to say thank you Katwise and thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: @m@zon

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine, it’s my 3rd one, I have specific colors so I don’t change them. It’s a work horse machine. You won’t be disappointed. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Girl

customer_reviews.title: First serger
customer_reviews.text: This is the first serger I have ever used. It’s amazing. I love it and it is really easy to use and thread.
customer_reviews.author: Corisue94

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE WORST SERGER. I have tried and tried to get it to work correctly, and it has never properly worked. Do not spend money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! You won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: This serger is the best! It blows my old singer serger out of the water! It's quiet, smooth, and easy to use. By far the best value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Bell

customer_reviews.title: Use online tutorials on your computer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this new machine. I was a bit disappointed that there isn't a method for catching the trimmed fabric scraps, but other than that, it's been the best serger I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I use my serger on canvas, upholstery fabric and denim. So far, no issues! It did take a while to thread, but once you get it down, it works magnificently well!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to move, works quickly and without issue.
customer_reviews.text: I have run close to 7000yds of thread through this machine in the last 10 months. I added oil right when I got it and haven't had to do anything since. No complaints at all. It sews quickly, rarely misses a stitch (when it does it is usually a thread issue) and is pretty easy to use. I move this machine around my work area quite a bit and it is no problem to move around. I love that it takes up so little space. The only drawback is that it does not have a basket to catch the waste fabric. I just use a basket from an old machine that died. I recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: goodoldgt

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: It sews like a dream - very sturdy, smooth and threading is not all that difficult. I had been using another brand, older machine which caused constant headaches and frustration. My new Juki is the complete opposite - I wish I would have purchased it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Champs Mom

customer_reviews.title: I owned an other domestic overlock before and it was complete crap compare to this one
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a complete beast! I owned an other domestic overlock before and it was complete crap compare to this one! I have only had it for a few days but so far so good i strongly suggest it
customer_reviews.author: livia

customer_reviews.title: This is a great serger for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great serger for the price! I recently purchased it and have already completed a number of items with it. I sew a lot of fleece and heavier fabrics and so far it sews like a dream. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I AM A SEAMSTRESS AND THIS IS MY 3RD SERGER AND BY FAR THE BEST! STURDY AND WORKS WELL. GOOD BASIC MACHINE.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully. The high reviews here are warranted
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. The high reviews here are warranted. Definitely a good purchase for the home sewing business.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for a Serger
customer_reviews.text: A great and sturdy machine! I am so happy to finally have a serger and I'm so glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: McShellie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Juki. It wasnt hard to thread but i am also experienced and this is my 3rd serger in 30 years. Worked like a gem right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Using for sewing garments. Works great! Easy to use! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shaunister

customer_reviews.title: Quite
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my girlfriend who is in the home decor industry like myself. I starting to love Juki brands 9 my new Singer) It works so smooth and mostly very quiet. Thks, Pillow Paradise and More, Inc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to serging. This machine is not too hard to thread. It's not noisy, either
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Lyons

customer_reviews.title: You will cry trying to thread this machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine is nearly impossible to thread. If I ever get another one, it will definitely be self-threading. Have had nothing but trouble with it (broken needles, crazy tension) since the day I bought it. Because of the threading issue I feel like giving up before even getting started on a project. I know some people love their Juki serger but it's just too frustrating for me.
customer_reviews.author: zoey

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHOICE!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I chose this model. It's so quiet, portable and eas to use! I'm not new to sewing but WAS new to serging. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELE

customer_reviews.title: Great serger for the money
customer_reviews.text: I hemmed and hawed over purchasing a serger. They're pricey, and I'm just a hobby sewist. This machine was recommended to me by several people. It's apparently the same machine as a much more expensive model. I had a little trouble with the initial threading (take out the threads that are in it all the way, and rethread according to the instructions!), but I've since rethreaded it a few times without trouble, and it's is pretty easy to use. I'm very happy I chose this serger.
customer_reviews.author: colleen b

customer_reviews.title: the product stopped working a week after my return expired.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this serger just over a month ago and it recently got jammed and has stopped working. Very disappointing. Do not order!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best machine for the price. I sew bathing suits from home and love this machine. You can even serger elastic easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Oelke

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good Product, Very little setup needed. You can also remove the left needle and first thread for smaller seam. Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: ABA SEMAR

customer_reviews.title: great product!!
customer_reviews.text: this machine rocks! i love it. it cuts & stitches through thick sweaters like nobody's business! i highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this serger
customer_reviews.text: My wife has made a lot of stuff with this serger.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Featherston

customer_reviews.title: Quick set up watching YouTube made it easy
customer_reviews.text: great for making mask due to the pandemic. Also for mending native clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Holiday

customer_reviews.title: My favorite serger
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing I'm in school for fashion and we have these in the classroom (maybe the older model) and this works better
customer_reviews.author: Adrie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to thread and easy to
customer_reviews.text: This machine works very well . Easy to thread and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Durable and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this based on other reviews at Amazon this machine is awesome nothing fancy just a good dependable machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mn

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it’s been a year and it still works great. No issues!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Juki Serger Review
customer_reviews.text: I love this serger. It took me a little bit to get used to how well it works comparising to my old worn out sewing machine. I would recommend this serger to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice sturdy machine
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a serger. I did my research and decided on this juki serger. It's a nice sturdy machine. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Love it, not sure how the heck I lived ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it, not sure how the heck I lived as a sewer prior to! A bit tough to thread, but once you do it several times it becomes a bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: Diane A. Perry-hill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little getting used to, to thread, but once threaded correctly works well.
customer_reviews.author: franco

customer_reviews.title: Good basic serger
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to use, very good serger for the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little machine! Runs very smoothly, cuts well and does a perfect rolled hem. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy F

customer_reviews.title: It's great so far
customer_reviews.text: It's great so far. I haven't used it much but it runs smooth and quiet.Seems to have enough power to sew heavy fabrics.
customer_reviews.author: kittycat

customer_reviews.title: she said that it's a wonderful machine and absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for my wife.....she said that it's a wonderful machine and absolutely loves it !
customer_reviews.author: James D Patterson

customer_reviews.title: And I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have finally got my Juki! And I love it.
customer_reviews.author: beth rubright

customer_reviews.title: LOVE  IT !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this same model & purchased this for my daughter. She loves it as do I. Easy to thread and preforms well on various types of fabrics.
customer_reviews.author: BARB   D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Being completely new to serging, I was a little apprehensive about using the Juki. I actually chose it based on it being mentioned by Katwise(see her amazing upcycled sweater creations on Etsy) in one of her tutorials. It is a wonderful machine! Fairly easy to use after a bit of a learning curve(which I am still on.) For the price, this has been a real deal!
customer_reviews.author: Libacious1

customer_reviews.title: new to serging
customer_reviews.text: Love! It purrs. Haven'the made a garment yet. Also, it took some time to callobrate. Great little machine. I can'tell to start up cycling my new wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second serger. I thought my first was great, Janome 7034D, but had to be repaired for the second time in four months with a cost of $90. Decided to purchase an additional serger, the Juki M0644D. This machine is amazing, fast serging, no vibration and quiet. I am one very pleased customer!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Farnham

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Threading this is no picnic however, once that is done it is a piece of cake. We are VERY happy with how it works and makes our pieces look a good deal more professional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Threading it was not so bad but I am having a great difficulty getting the ...
customer_reviews.text: Threading it was not so bad but I am having a great difficulty getting the tension correct. There is a lot of thread above the material from both the front and back. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: sarah Becklund

customer_reviews.title: d
customer_reviews.text: I waited for this to arrive. Since it came I have used it amost every day. I love love love this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Baugh

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE mine
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my biz and I am thinking of buying a second ... It is a wonderful machine :) so easy to use and is super fast
customer_reviews.author: brandi ice

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Reliable. Threading is not a problem. First serger and it has been great so far. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: mary knierim

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Red thread keep breaking. Have been trying to fix this problem but nothing help.
customer_reviews.author: titi

customer_reviews.title: but found this quite easy.
customer_reviews.text: I am having to learn using a serger, but found this quite easy.
customer_reviews.author: hoser13

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, I'm just a learner and vie managed to sew up a few garments already in the past month that vie had it, really quiet, no sliding round, color coded threading system, and nice and fast! Id definitely recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Wierenga

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Juki server! It came wonderfully packaged and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Holmberg

customer_reviews.title: Pressed foot lifter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine a week ago. I like the way it runs and all but hate that the presses foot lifter is behind the needles where I have to let go of the fabrics to lift the foot. I am returning the machine!
customer_reviews.author: Jeani

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it 4 stars because I haven't had a chance to use it except on one small item before I left for 3 weeks, and I just got back. As far as I can tell, it's very well made and I am very impressed w/ the stitches, they are by far the most professional looking stitch I have ever seen a serger make; very uniform and finished looking. It runs very smoothy w/o the bouncing I was used to w/ my Kenmore. It probably deserves a 5, but I'd like to get to know it better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for novices and experts!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a work horse. I see more than most people, with a large a variety of fabrics and this machine is amazing. It can handle layers and layers of denim and fleece without skipping a stitch. It can also handle delicate satin and simile fabrics with ease. This is my second serger of the same model. I had the first for over ten years before I decided to replace it. It really is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Wright

customer_reviews.title: It's NOT a 2-3-4 thread, it's a 3-4 thread
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love the machine! It came pre-threaded which was awesome! Each step of the threading process is color coded so it's not near as difficult as I thought it would be. I also found a "YouTube" video that walked you through the process very well and I was up and running in no time. The only problem I've had is that the description states that it is a 2-3-4 thread machine and the converter needed to make it a 2-thread didn't come with it. Very disappointing, otherwise, it would have gotten 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: markari

customer_reviews.title: Love this serger
customer_reviews.text: Love this serger, but I fear the quality isn’t as good as Juki used to be. The first one I bought had to be exchanged due to the motor completely locking up after 6 days of very light use. It just made a loud humming noise and the motor wouldn’t run. Even the manual turn wheel had locked up and couldn’t be turned. I just got the replacement in a week ago and the light bulb only lasted 3 days. So disappointed in the quality of these two Juki sergers :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why won’t this stitch properly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve watched 4-5 videos on how to use this machine. I can’t figure out what is going wrong but it hasn’t formed 1 good stitch. It keeping looking like this on the underside of the fabric. I’ve adjusted tension, stitch length...everything. Nothing helps. Returning this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Retro

customer_reviews.title: More than disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday. I have spent two days attempting to make it stitch properly, watched numerous videos about adjustments and tried every single one, rethreaded at least 10 times, searched in vain for live help from Juki and/or Amazon, and I cannot make it run properly. Given the Covid situation I cannot take it anywhere for help. Such a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Juki MO644D
customer_reviews.text: I do love it. It is easy to thread and purrs along happily. I admit I haven't put her through all she can do but I'm happy with the choice. I have had my 3-thread Juki for about 8 years and felt confident in upgrading to a new Juki. It took a little getting used to with the threading and spool placement but after I got the hang of it I've been serging away.
customer_reviews.author: Paula A Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice little machine
customer_reviews.text: This was surprisingly easy to thread. I heard horror stories about threading sergers but I followed a YouTube video on the Juki page and it was painless. I made 3 Unpaper towels to test out the tension and stitch length so far my threads are on the correct side but my fabric waves not bad for one night of practice. This is my first time using a serger ever hopefully it lasts a while.
customer_reviews.author: E. N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice serger for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice serger for the price. I wish I could have gotten on with a closing stitch. Why can't I find a serger, sewing machine, and closing stitch all in one. That would be cool. The next model up is better because it threads easier, I would have liked that one better. Judi servers are the best, I love the honeycomb threading and it always makes a nice serger with easy to switch over to hem.
customer_reviews.author: maurine

customer_reviews.title: A very good tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I discovered both the brand and using a serger machine and I am a big fan of both. I purchased a regular sewing machine of the same brand which is also easy to use, compact and well made. The possibilities are endless! I was able to make a dozen curtains and a good few napkins with the remnants, all in a weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Benedicte_Gbury

customer_reviews.title: did not arrive like new
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and ordered the used product because it stated 'like new'. However, it was not like new; the light bulb was missing, both needles were visibly dull, and one of the loops to thread through was bent. The machine was also dirty inside. I should have just spent $30 more to get a new machine elsewhere. Fortunately, the machine ran great or I would be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH

customer_reviews.title: Love this serger!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this serger!! It makes sewing projects so much faster for my 10 year old daughter. She made pajama pants for the family at Christmas and it was a breeze for her! Great videos on YouTube that show how to thread if you're not a person who can figure it out from a diagram like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W.

customer_reviews.title: Basic and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is head and shoulders above my Viking serger, it is easy to adjust and it handles a variety of material weights well. It is basic, no frills, and very utilitarian which is exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: great buy.. don't think long.. just go ahead, have it, today
customer_reviews.text: it was delivered veeery fast.. first i had some struggle with it because thread had cut very frequently, then i found out that the problem was the thread itself, so when i changed it my juki now is working like Big Ben of London.. i love it..
customer_reviews.author: reemara

customer_reviews.title: Quality Machine Worth the Extra $
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I should spend the extra $100-200 for this compared to other sergers, but the quality of the machine was so impressive the minute I sewed my first seam. My mother was a seamstress her entire life and gave me my first sewing machine when I was 12, so I know a bit about sewing and machines. I am super-happy with this machine and shipping was quick!
customer_reviews.author: wehav2

customer_reviews.title: This is the server you want
customer_reviews.text: Awesome home machine! It's a great replacement for my studio's old huge heavy loud industrial machine. I bought it on recommendation from the Katwise sweater coat tutorial.
customer_reviews.author: L.Herigstad

customer_reviews.title: Nice serge
customer_reviews.text: Had to return mine In less than a couple months. Stopped working properly. Receive a replacement and I Just hope it doesn’t do the same. Fingers crossed because I want to love this machine. Serge's so well.
customer_reviews.author: deborah donahue

customer_reviews.title: Juki’s an amazing company!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Mother’s Day gift and it was perfect. Now I want to buy one for myself lol
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good serger
customer_reviews.text: Quite easy to follow instructions. Easy to use. I am delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Celia J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine I bought it for the 2nd time, the first I left overseas. I had it for 8 year and never had any problems, I replaced the light bulb once in an 8 years. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Shila

customer_reviews.title: I love this Juki
customer_reviews.text: I love this Juki! The last one I owned, I had for 30 years and this one sews even better. I love the built in light feature also! GREAT serger!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... 2 years since buying this machine and it is great little machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's been 2 years since buying this machine and it is great little machine for the price. I sew practically everyday and it keeps plugging along. Thought if you were trying to decide which serger to buy it would be nice to know this one holds up. Now hopefully I haven't jinxed myself and I will continue to get several more years out of this JUKI!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: JUKI MO644D Portable Serger
product_meta.description: Put Juki industrial sewing machine technology to work in your home. Juki's know how incorporated powerful, dedicated drive cutting system, ease of use and high quality stitch formation in their household use sergers. Convertible 2/3/4 thread serging with automatic rolled hem capability. Color coded threading and breakaway looper for easy, correct threading. The upper knife moves out of the way for safe and easy threading access. Adjustable stitch length and differential feed. This machine comes with a multi purpose foot for sewing a wide variety of stitches and products including tape, and elastic. Wide variety of optional presser feet available for cording, blind stitch, piping, gathering, etc."Serger Knobs, stitch length and differential feed" are built into the machine and located internally on the left side of the machine when the cloth bed is opened.
feature_bullets: 2/3/4 Thread serger with automatic rolled hem
Powerful knife system with dedicated drive mechanism. Sewing Speed - Max. 1500 spm
Sews light to medium weight fabric
Color coded threading breakaway looper adjustment for stitch length and differential feed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars268 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
